net.corda.client.rpc.ext

Class MultiRPCClient<I>

  • net.corda.client.rpc.ext.MultiRPCClient<I>

  • public class MultiRPCClient<I>

    An RPC client connects to the specified server and allows to make calls using specified remote interface to the server that perform various useful tasks. Please see the Client RPC section of Corda Documentation to learn more about how this API works. Only a brief description is provided here.

    Calling MultiRPCClient.start returns an interface RPCConnection containing a proxy that allows making RPCs calls to the server. This is a blocking communication, and if the server throws an exception then it will be rethrown on the client. Proxies are thread safe and may be used to invoke multiple RPCs in parallel.

    RPC sends and receives are logged on the net.corda.rpc logger.

    In case of loss of connection to the server, the client will try to reconnect using the settings provided via class CordaRPCClientConfiguration. If the client was created using a list of hosts via haAddressPool, automatic failover will occur (the servers have to be started in HA mode). While attempting failover, current and future RPC calls will throw class RPCException.

    It is also possible to add interface RPCConnectionListeners event before connection is started to be notified about connection lifecycle. Please see documentation on interface RPCConnectionListener for more details.

    See Also:
    Corda Documentation, MultiRPCClient.start, interface RPCConnection, class CordaRPCClientConfiguration, class RPCException, interface RPCConnectionListener, interface RPCConnectionListener

        Returns:
        true if the element has been added, false when listener is already contained in the set of listeners.
        See Also:

      • removeConnectionListener

        public boolean removeConnectionListener(RPCConnectionListener<I> listener)

        Returns:
        true if the element has been successfully removed; false if it was not present in the set of listeners.
        See Also:
        interface RPCConnectionListener, class MultiRPCClient

      • start

        public java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<net.corda.client.rpc.RPCConnection> start()

        Logs in to the target server and returns an active connection.

        It only makes sense to this method once. If it is called repeatedly it will return the same by reference CompletableFuture

        Returns:
        CompletableFuture containing interface RPCConnection or throwing class RPCException if the server version is too low or if the server is not reachable within a reasonable timeout or if login credentials provided are incorrect.
        See Also:
        CompletableFuture

        Stops the client and closes interface RPCConnection if it has been previously established
